transcripts.text: Hey everybody, this is Deb with Truthification Chronicles.  This video is awesome.  There's really actually no video to it.  It's just this same picture all the way through.  But the audio, definitely you need to hear this interview with the Genova because it really puts things into perspective about what has been going on and what is being hidden from us and also what we might see when the declassification happens because there are some documents I think that are going to come out that we just aren't aware of at this time.  I'm going to play a couple of clips from the end, and I want to point out some of the stuff that he's saying there because very important stuff.  If you're maybe new to the 17th letter of the alphabet, you may never have heard of one of these guys.  And so I really want you to hear what he has to say.  So here we go.
When those 2012 abuses you said were used as a pretext to leak information to the press, who were they targeting, the 2012 abuses?

politicians, opponents of the Obama administration.  How do you think Samantha Power got 250 names?  How do you think she was able to seek the unmasking of that many people?  She says it wasn't she that did it.  She says someone did it in her name.  Now, who do you think made 250 queries of NSA databases in her name?  It was the four contractors who were working for the FBI, read James Comey, who were unauthorizedly accessing NSA databases.  That's the scandal.  That's what this is about.  That's where Samantha Power's 250 names came from, the people who were the contractors working for the FBI.
There's a big lack of curiosity about contractors using government officials' names to access information like that.

So, yeah, these illegal queries that were going on by contractors is really the big news.  But do you hear any of the mainstream media talking about it?  Oh, no, you don't.  You know, they are avoiding it completely.  Why?  Because they don't want this truth to come out.  And notice he said 2012.  We're not talking about 2016.  We're talking about 2012.  And who was president then?  Oh, yeah.  So let's go on.

Information like that.  So now that Bill Barr has this power that the president has extended to him to declassify all of this information, what's at the top of your wish list for him to go after first?

Well, he needs to put John Carlin in the grand jury right after Mike Rogers.  The former head of NSA Mike Rogers is the American hero in this entire story.  It is he who revealed the illegal spying, which started in 2012.  It is he who went to the FISA courts And it is he that John Carlin, Ash Carter, and James Clapper tried to get fired for going to the court.  I would put Mike Rogers in the grand jury first as a friendly witness.

So if you've been with me for a while you probably have seen my videos on Mike Rogers and not only that but there's also the one on the illegal queries because this is the keystone of it.  Mike Rogers who was the head of the NSA at the time discovered what was going on with these illegal queries happening and they were not being done legally.  It was all illegally done by contractors not even by the people that were supposed to be doing them.  And so this is what was happening with all this material.  that's in the NSA database.  And yeah, you know, the NSA database is huge because they have that new facility out there in Utah.  And, you know, they have everything, okay?  The NSA really does have everything.  You know, I know a couple of people have mentioned that they think the lawyers and everything that were part of Mueller's team were really destroying evidence.  Well, you know, it's not going to matter because the NSA already has copies of it.  They've got everything, folks.  They really do.  Anyway, what he's saying here about Rogers is so important because Rogers is a keystone of this.  He really is.  He's the person who knows what was going on.  And, you know, he was not only the head of the NSA, he was also head of U.S.  Cyber Command.  Both of them at the same time.  That's why he was such a threatening person and they needed to try to get rid of him.  The problem was they waited until after the election.  Well, the election didn't go the way they wanted it to.  So then they went into a panic and all of a sudden it was like, we got to get rid of Rogers.  He's going to get us all in trouble.  He's going to put all this out there and Trump is going to listen to him and we're going to be in trouble.  So that's why they all of a sudden decided we need to get rid of Rogers.  And they trumped up a bunch of charges.  And this John Carlin was one of the people that was behind that move to try to get rid of Rogers.  Let me play the rest of the clip here.

Friendly witness.  And then the next witness would be John Carlin, the former head of the National Security Division of the Justice Department.  Nobody knows who he is.  Nobody's ever heard the name, but he is the person who tried to get Mike Rogers fired for being honest with the court.  And John Carlin is also the person who filed, just before he resigned from the Justice Department, a false certification to defy the court that they were obeying the rules, when in fact they weren't.  And when Judge Collier issued her opinion, she accused John Carlin of what she called an institutional lack of candor.  In other words, he lied to her.  Wow.

Now, for those who have been following that 17th letter of the alphabet, you know who John Carlin is.  You've heard of him.  And that's why he was so important that the 17th letter of the alphabet had to mention him, because he was the person that tried to get rid of Rogers.  And all of this went on during that transitional time between the election and the inauguration.  Yep, lots of things were happening right then and I can't help but wonder if the reason Rogers retired back in June of last year, I think maybe he did it so he could testify.  You know, I could be wrong on that.  Maybe he could testify anyway, but maybe there's like a different freedom that when he is not, you know, in that position that he's able to say some things that maybe he wouldn't have been able to say had he still been in that position. Now, I'm not sure about that, but I do think that because Trump set it up the way he did with Barr, that he gave him the authority, I think that he can bypass them because it was set up to bypass Coats' office because Coats, as the DNI, the Director of National Intelligence, has been blockading a lot of things, too. You know, both Ray and Haspel have been career people in those organizations pretty much.  So it's probably going to be difficult for them to allow the reputations of these organizations to be pretty much destroyed by what's going to come out.  But it has to be.
